column1: #Text=Polycrystalline Eu2In samples were prepared by melting stoichiometric quantities of elemental starting materials followed by annealing in a conventional resistive furnace.
#Text=The high-purity europium metal was supplied by the Materials Preparation Center of the Ames Laboratory.
#Text=All operations and handling of the samples were carried out in Ar glovebox.
#Text=The starting materials were sealed in a Ta crucible under a partial atmosphere of ultrapure Ar.
#Text=The crucible was then sealed in a quartz tube backfilled with helium gas.
#Text=The sample was first melted several times at 900 째C in a resistance furnace, flipping the sample tube between each melting.
#Text=Then the sample was annealed at 650 째C for 24 h.
#Text=The resulting sample has a grey metallic appearance, and is relatively brittle.
#Text=Exposure to air leads to darkening of the surface within a few hours.
#Text=The results presented in this communication originate from the same sample, but different samples prepared to ensure reproducibility demonstrate comparable properties.
